dt: {bc}the act or action of crossing: such as
{bc}an opposing, blocking, or thwarting especially in an unfair or dishonest manner
{bc}a place or structure (as on a street or over a river) where pedestrians or vehicles {a_link|cross}
{bc}the place in a cruciform church where the transept {a_link|crosses} the nave
{bc}a place where a railroad track crosses a street

shortdef: the act or action of crossing: such as
an opposing, blocking, or thwarting especially in an unfair or dishonest manner

dt: {bc}a crossing of highways, railroad tracks, or pedestrian walks or combinations of these on the same level

shortdef: a crossing of highways, railroad tracks, or pedestrian walks or combinations of these on the same level

dt: {bc}a crosswalk marked by a series of broad white stripes to indicate a crossing point at which pedestrians have the right of way

shortdef: a crosswalk marked by a series of broad white stripes to indicate a crossing point at which pedestrians have the right of way
